locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of the Fall in Eden, transitioning into a cultural critique of American nostalgia, and concluding with a vision of a future 'New Eden' found in Christ.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The sermon uses the text as a springboard for a 'mood' or 'notion' rather than a rigorous grammatical-historical exegesis. It relies heavily on poetic imagery and literary allusion (Francis Thompson, Andrew Maclaren).

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily describes a human condition (nostalgia/loss) and points toward a future possibility. The force is largely descriptive and suggestive rather than authoritative or declarative.
voorbeelden: There lingers on the edge of human memory a mood...
Eden was an ineffably beautiful place.
I would point out that Eden is not the last garden...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from nostalgia/despair to a sense of hope and 'adequacy' for the future.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The sermon focuses on the 'power of Christ' and 'faith' as human capacities or external aids, but lacks explicit invocation of the Spirit's current agency.

voorbeelden: Eden was an ineffably beautiful place.
The past is a closed garden.
This country is no longer primarily a nation of the countryside.
Woe to us if we fail him.
Ah, no, this old account speaks a deep and persuasive truth.
The Lord will make us sufficient unto whatever we must face.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are framed as general theological truths (Assertives) rather than God binding Himself to the hearer in the moment.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Absent. The preacher does not speak 'in persona Christi' to change the hearer's status (e.g., 'Your sins are forgiven').

indicatoren: Talking 'about' the New Eden as a concept rather than opening its gates.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a beautiful poetic idea rather than a participant in a divine event.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration without transformation; the 'event' is replaced by an 'explanation'.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'we' (inclusive of preacher and audience) or 'I' as a guide ('I would point out').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Limited. Used mostly in the final exhortation ('You and I') or hypothetical husband/wife examples.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low. Used for moral encouragement, not for bestowing grace.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about Adam, Eve, America, and 'the man of faith'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It treats the Gospel as a narrative to be observed.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Description of Eden/Fall) -> Assertive (Description of New Eden) -> Directive (Look ahead).
voorbeelden: The last Eden is seen by those who have faith... So don't look back. Look ahead!
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative ('Look ahead') is not preceded by a performative act of God that enables the looking.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We can go on to that Eden... So don't look back.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a poetic lecture. It provides a beautiful 'map' of the biblical narrative but fails to 'transport' the hearer into the reality it describes.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Brooks sang soft songs which charmed the mind...

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: There lingers on the edge of human memory...
The Lord will make us sufficient...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Stated as a fact about God, not a promise from God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'talk about' a potential event, rather than the event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Creative Word' (Declarative) that changes the hearer's reality.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of description, not the subject of the speech act.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: No. The preacher speaks as a poet/philosopher.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly relies on the hearer's 'faith' and 'mature wisdom' rather than the Spirit's work.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is founded upon mature wisdom...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. The sermon is a means of inspiration/information.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Low. The language is 'about' the epiphany of the New Eden, but doesn't manifest it.
tekstueel_bewijs: On ahead the gates of another Eden swing wide.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from past-tense 'was' and third-person 'it' to present-tense 'is' and second-person 'you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord will make us sufficient.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Lord makes you sufficient this very moment.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a future possibility to a present reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The grace of Christ is described as a 'bright presence' but never specifically applied to the hearer's sin or need.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Insert a direct promise of Christ's adequacy for the hearer's specific 'brambles and briars'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ promises you today that His grace is your new Eden.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'you' who feels the loss of innocence.
voorbeeldzinnen: You cannot go back, but Christ meets you here.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Look ahead' command is a heavy lift without the 'I have opened the gate' declaration.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the gate open before commanding the look.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and poetically rich, but it remains a 'constative surplus'. By moving from 'talking about Eden' to 'opening Eden' through commissive and declarative speech, the preacher can turn this lecture into a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'. SAT reveals that the sermon fails not because of the preacher's personality, but because the words lack the illocutionary force of a divine mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, this is excellent (alliteration, metaphors). Homiletically (SAT), it is weak because it does not 'do' what it 'says'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'New Eden' remains a distant concept because the preacher uses Assertives instead of Declaratives to bring it into the room.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Eden was an ineffably beautiful place.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for atmosphere, zero for encounter.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: So don't look back. Look ahead!
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Weak; lacks the performative ground of grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Preaching as Art' rather than 'Preaching as Act'.
